awd_titl_txt: Structural and Metamorphic Evolution of the Walker Lee Lake Arrigetch Peaks Region, Central Brooks Range, Alaska
awd_abstract_narration: During development of collisional orogens high pressure-low                temperature metamorphism commonly forms during the subduction                   phase, but is often obscured by post-tectonic thermal                           equilibration or by later deformation and mineral growth.  The                  metamorphic core of the Brooks range exposes regional high                      pressure-low temperature rocks adjacent to lower grade fold and                 thrust belt rocks.  This project will map structures across this                structural/metamorphic boundary, conduct thermobarometry on                     collected samples and perform radiometric age determination.                    Results will be used to characterize the metamorphic and                        structural conditions during orogenesis and to determine the                    uplift history of these high pressure/low temperature rocks.

inst.inst_name: New Mexico Institute of Mining and Technology
